name: Table
description: A table to be rendered into a pdf. The table is more or less just a nested hash. Formatting options and table sections(footer, header, body) are on the top level. Rows with cells and options are nested in array-hash structures beneath each section-key.

header.description: Header rows with an array of cells for each row.

body.description: Body rows with an array of cells for each row.

footer.description: Footer rows with an array of cells for each row.

page_break_header.description: Carry over header row. The content of the the last cell is being replace with page_break_value(page_break_footer) from the last body row cell.

page_break_footer.description: Carry over header row used as a template for page breaks. The content of the the last cell is being replace with page_break_value from the last body row cell.

showcells.description: Show the border of each inner cell. More or less just for debugging.

showborder.description: Show the outer border of a table

showgrid.description: Draw a border for the vertical and horizontal boundaries of all columns and rows

fill.description: fill rows or columns with color

area.description: Defines the area to be filled with the given fillcolor. col#: column number # in the table

stroke.description: Draw border-lines for rows or columns: 'stroke': [{'line':'horother', 'strokecolor':'rgb 0 0 0' }]

line.description: Defines the area to be filled: vert0: line at the right border of column number #; vert0 is the left table border
